references.paper_title: Deep learning for person re-identification: A survey and outlook
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of deep learning techniques for person re-identification, which is the broader context of the current research on cross-spectral re-identification.

references.paper_title: Learning to reduce dual-level discrepancy for infrared-visible person re-identification
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the core challenge of cross-spectral re-identification, focusing on the discrepancy between infrared and visible images, providing a baseline method for comparison.
Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are a fundamental technique used in many cross-spectral re-identification methods, representing a key technology used to address the modality gap.

references.paper_title: Multi-spectral sift for scene category recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of multi-spectral image analysis for scene recognition, laying the foundation for techniques used in cross-spectral re-identification.
This paper introduces a benchmark dataset (SYSU-MM01) for cross-spectral re-identification, which is crucial for evaluating the proposed method and comparing it with existing approaches.
